abstract: |
  This technical report documents the updated NuSEDS escapement estimate type classification guidance and the property-first decision key used to assign estimate Types 1-6. The update is motivated by inconsistent application of the current table-only guidance across operational groups, downstream use of estimate types in Wild Salmon Policy rapid status workflows, and the need for clearer public-facing interpretation as Pacific salmon data transparency initiatives expand. The key separates enumeration and estimation methods, standardizes method families, and applies downgrade criteria for coverage, visibility, documentation, and precision. The classification logic is encoded in a structured YAML file and implemented in an R engine and Shiny application to support consistent use across programs. This draft summarizes the decision gates, method families, and implementation details, and provides illustrative classification outcomes.

csas_kable <- function(x,
                       caption = NULL,
                       align = NULL,
                       ...) {
  align_kable <- align
  if (!is.null(align) && length(align) > 1) {
    align_kable <- paste0(align, collapse = "")
  }

  if (knitr::is_latex_output()) {
    csasdown::csas_table(
      x,
      format = "latex",
      caption = caption,
      align = align,
      ...
    )
  } else if (knitr::is_html_output()) {
    knitr::kable(
      x,
      format = "html",
      caption = caption,
      align = align_kable,
      escape = TRUE
    ) |>
      kableExtra::kable_styling(full_width = FALSE)
  } else {
    knitr::kable(
      x,
      caption = caption,
      align = align_kable,
      escape = TRUE
    )
  }
}
